Chile:
Founding of Valdivia.
Lautaro, after six years' imprisonment by the Spanish, escapes. He then teaches his people European warfare, including riding horses.
India: Guru Amar Das becomes third Guru of Sikhs.
Malta: Construction of Fort Saint Michael, in Senglea. Fearing further razzias by Turks and Barbary corsairs, one thousand Maltese flee Malta, seeking refuge in Sicily.
Russia: Siege of Kazan (1552): Russian armed forces arrived at Kazan. Siege of Kazan (1552): The Russian army breached the walls of Kazan. Siege of Kazan (1552): The civilian population of Kazan was massacred, the city occupied.
